meanings.definition: Stop or restrict (a flow of blood) from a wound.
meanings.sent1: The nurse was stanching the bleeding with a bandage.
meanings.sent2: He quickly applied pressure to the wound, stanching the blood flow.
meanings.sent3: The bandage played the hero role in stanching the blood flow.
meanings.sent4: Her quick action in stanching the bleeding saved the day.
meanings.sent5: The image of the bandage stanching the blood was etched in his memory.

meanings.definition: To check or stop the flowing of (a liquid).
meanings.sent1: The plumber was stanching the leak in the pipe.
meanings.sent2: She used a bucket to stanch the flow of water from the tap.
meanings.sent3: The water seemed to play hide and seek, stanching its escape.
meanings.sent4: His words acted as a dam, stanching the flood of emotions.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the bucket stanching the water flow was oddly satisfying.
